intro: Nauchea ternatea, commonly known as the Ternate sea hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Indo-Pacific region. It is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that typically range in color from yellow to red. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and thrives in coastal environments, often found in sandy or muddy soils. Nauchea ternatea is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. It plays a role in coastal ecosystems by stabilizing shorelines and providing habitat for small marine organisms.
